$XRP As the year draws toward its final pages, there is a feeling in the air‚Äîan almost alchemical tension. Moments like these have always preceded transformation. History shows us that rewards often arrive quietly, after patience has been tested and conviction refined.


Happiness, in this sense, is not only measured in price or profit. It is found in alignment: when vision meets timing, when perseverance meets possibility. Many XRP holders feel this alignment now‚Äînot as certainty, but as resonance.

$XRP was one of the first markets that exposed the gaps in my approach when I joined the Bitget Trading Club Championship. Without a clear, structured strategy, my execution lacked consistency, and I eventually dropped off the leaderboard.

Heading into this week‚Äôs phase, I‚Äôm returning with a more disciplined framework. My strategy is clearer, risk management is tighter, and I now have a better understanding of what actually improves consistency and performance.

Global financial alignment is here  It began with $XRP  and $ETH  and it continues with Rayls.  Rayls don‚Äôt force TradFi into DeFi, instead they built a Layer 1 that actually fits how real financial institutions work.  By allowing public and private environments work together,  regulated institutions can issue and manage real-world assets on-chain without exposing sensitive data or breaking regulatory rules. This is the unlock crypto has been waiting for.  With huge institutional support from Nuclea in Brazil and MiCA in Europe, Rayls solves a global issue.  #Macro Insights#

Somehow the real winners this cycle
weren‚Äôt builders or users

They were rug founders

The playbook is always the same

Launch a project
Even better if it‚Äôs another chain nobody asked for
Hype the vision
Sell an ICO at a huge FDV

Promise the community an airdrop
Then quietly redirect it to insiders

Launch with low float
High valuation
Distribute tokens to side wallets

Development slows
Then stops

Founders start shorting
Then selling
Then selling more

When price collapses
Blame the community for not ‚Äúbelieving‚Äù

Meanwhile
Founders get preferential deals elsewhere
Free allocations
Private access

They short those too

When the token is down 80%
It‚Äôs suddenly ‚Äúmarket conditions‚Äù

Personal accounts gain followers
Exit liquidity secured
Next cycle lined up

And somehow
They ‚Äúwin‚Äù the cycle

The real question
How do we make this unprofitable
Or stop rewarding it altogether
 $SUI  $XRP

Sometimes the best move is doing nothing and letting the market breathe.


Happy #BoxingDay everyone enjoy the calm before the next move.

$XRP  is still moving inside a descending channel, but bulls are trying to spark a recovery.  A clean push above the 20-day EMA at $1.93 would be the first real sign of strength.  If that happens, price could move toward the 50-day SMA at $2.09, with the descending trendline as the next upside test.   On the flip side: A rejection from current levels or the moving averages would show bears are still in control.  Key support sits at $1.61  a break below this could open the door to $1.25.   Still a make-or-break zone here. Waiting for confirmation is key.  Ôªø#Ripple  #Macro Insights#

A 1 billion XRP escrow release is scheduled for 1 January 2026. As per Ripple‚Äôs usual pattern, approximately 300 million XRP may enter circulation, while around 700 million XRP is expected to be re-escrowed for a future release.

With shrinking exchange supply (notably on Binance) and multiple ETF proposals under discussion, XRP could be positioned for meaningful long-term growth.

Major financial institutions are primarily focusing on ETF-grade digital assets, including:
BTC, ETH, SOL, XRP, HBAR, and increasingly SUI.

Other assets that are also being discussed or explored in institutional ETF conversations include ADA, AVAX, DOT and LTC.

Over time, projects with weak utility, poor liquidity, or no institutional relevance are likely to fade.

Think wisely. Stay long. Stay strong.

$XRP  \/USDT ‚Äì Consolidating Below Multi-Year Horizontal Resistance (1H & Daily View) XRP is currently trading at $18487 USDT, holding in prolonged consolidation beneath a major overhead resistance zone around $1.94‚Äì$1.98 that has rejected multiple rallies throughout late 2025. Price action shows extended downside from earlier highs near $2.00+, forming lower highs but consistent respect of lower supports with compression visible. The structure remains range-bound with bearish tilt short-term, but seller exhaustion could set up reversal if buyers absorb supply. A confirmed close above $1.98 with expanding volume would signal breakout strength, potentially targeting $2.10‚Äì$2.20. Rejection could extend sideways or retest supports toward $1.80‚Äì$1.82. Key Levels:  Resistance zone: $1.94‚Äì$1.98 (multi-month pivot) Breakout trigger: $1.98 (daily close above) Upside targets: $2.10‚Äì$2.20 Support: dynamic lower (~$1.80‚Äì$1.82), deeper (~$1.70)  Traders should monitor volume confirmation near resistance before positioning. Ripple's XRP continues to lead in cross-border payments with ODL growth, RLUSD stablecoin launch, and institutional partnerships driving real-world utility. Regulatory clarity post-SEC settlement and ETF inflows support long-term holder accumulation amid 2025 volatility. Watch for broader market rotations or network upgrades as potential catalysts for breakout.

$XRP has been in a clear downtrend for weeks, shaking out late longs and forcing weak hands to exit.

Price is now sitting on a major support zone around $1.85, an area that previously attracted strong buyers and slowed selling pressure.

Momentum is starting to stabilize here. If this level continues to hold, we could see a relief bounce toward $2.20‚Äì$2.30, offering solid upside from current prices.

That said, the trend hasn‚Äôt flipped yet. Bulls need to step in with volume to confirm strength, otherwise a breakdown remains possible.
This is a key decision zone for XRP.

$XRP  Quantum threat protection developed for XRP Ledger The #XRP  Ledger (XRPL) team has integrated ‚Äúfull protection‚Äù against the threat posed by quantum computers into the AlphaNet developer network. This was announced by Denis Angell, lead software engineer at XRPL Labs. According to him, the update affected all key elements of the protocol architecture: accounts, consensus, and transactions. The blockchain community has different estimates of how long it will take for the new computing technology to crack elliptic curve cryptography (ECC). Most networks, including Bitcoin and Ethereum, use such encryption methods. It is assumed that with the development of quantum computers, it will become possible to obtain a private key from a public one using Shor's algorithm. And, judging by all appearances, the XRP team is at the forefront of implementing solutions to this problem‚úÖ

If $BTC   breaks $89,000, the mainstream CEX cumulative short liquidation pressure will reach 600 million. On December 27th, Coinglass data highlights two critical Bitcoin liquidation thresholds for major centralized exchanges (CEXs): - If Bitcoin breaks above $89,000, cumulative short liquidation intensity will hit $600 million. - Conversely, a drop below $86,000 would trigger $421 million in cumulative long liquidation intensity. BlockBeats Note: Liquidation charts do not display the exact number or value of contracts at risk of liquidation. Instead, the bars represent the **relative importance** of each liquidation cluster compared to neighboring clusters‚Äîdefined as "intensity." This means the chart shows how strongly the underlying asset‚Äôs price will react when it hits a specific level. A taller "liquidation bar" signals a more intense response once the price reaches that threshold, driven by a liquidity frenzy.  Ôªø#BTC Price Analysis#  #Macro Insights#  $XRP

In continuation of my previous post:

Over the past month alone, approximately 750 million XRP has been locked up by ETFs.

Meanwhile, large institutional players, asset managers, financial institutions, and ETF issuers rarely buy in a single, visible transaction. Instead, they accumulate discreetly, splitting large orders into smaller, strategic trades (iceberging) to avoid driving the price higher too quickly.

This approach allows them to absorb substantial selling pressure without triggering a major price move, creating the appearance of sideways price action while meaningful demand builds beneath the surface. Retail investors often label this as ‚Äúmanipulation,‚Äù but in reality, this is simply how institutions accumulate at scale, quietly and patiently.

If this rate of ETF accumulation continues month after month, irrespective of how many new XRP ETFs launch‚Äîthe monthly escrow release will barely be sufficient to meet demand.
Once the market fully recognises this hidden institutional accumulation and growing supply scarcity, a sharp and sustained re-pricing of XRP becomes inevitable.

As XRP appreciates, ISO-aligned assets are likely to follow quietly. Intelligent investors position themselves ahead of the curve, that is, when valuations are still favourable, and that window is NOW.
$XRP asleep like all those paid influencers

The 3‚Äëmonth $XRP   liquidation heatmap shows that most leveraged positions are stacked above the current price, with bright liquidity bands signaling where traders have placed leveraged bets.   Because these zones sit higher than where $XRP   is trading now, a price rise toward them could trigger forced liquidations that accelerate upward movement and volatility. However, the concentration of leverage also means those levels could act as resistance if the price struggles to reach them.   The key takeaway is that the heatmap suggests upside pressure and heightened volatility, rather than a calm, stable market.
